page.title: 01NENE VALLEY
page.content: The area south of Daventry is typical rural Northants, being agricultural and unspolied. The River Nene rises here and flows W-E cutting the grid in two. The whole area is undulating borded in the north by Newnham Hill (200m) and in the south by the ancient wooded slopes of Badby Downs part of Badby Woods dating back at least to 944ad. Two main settlements exist in the shape of Newnham and Badby Villages. There is a small hamlet at Little Everdon. The villages are similar in character having agriculture as their root although this has changed and the populations consist of retired people or commuters to Daventry and Northampton. There are many self employed people, several who occupy small offices and centres from their homes in the villages. The gradual reduction in numbers of
